hackathon-description-text: Participants in this virtual hackathon have the opportunity to hack for solutions that will transform the traditional travel process into a modern and seamless experience.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Chief Developer Evangelist / VP OpenAPI at MasterCard / Mastercard
Director, Next Gen Computing- Wearables, IOT// Mentor to 500 Startups// Board Happy Farm Incubator
Associate Deputy Airport Director, Communications & Marketing at San Francisco International Airport
Direct Mobile Apps & Wearables / American Airlines
Chief Innovation Officer for Mayor Lee / City and County of San Francisco

hackathon-rules:
Limit one (1) entry per person.
Teams are limited to (4) people.
Any additional data sets used during the Hackathon must be available to the public. If you have suggestions regarding additional public data sets that could be used for this event, please email kyle (at) wearableworld (dot) co.
This hackathon is open to virtual conetestants.
AT LEAST ONE MEMBER OF WINNING TEAM MUST BE PRESENT (IN PERSON) AT THE SAN FRANCISCO INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT ON DECEMBER 17TH, 2014

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $1000 for team that SFO selects as Best Use of SFO's API
American Airlines will be awarding 25,000 AAdvantage Miles per team member (max 5) to the 1st place winning team at the Grand Finale on December 17, 2014.
American Airlines will be awarding 15,000 AAdvantage Miles per team member (max 5) to the 2nd place winning team at the Grand Finale on December 17, 2014.
American Airlines will be awarding 10,000 AAdvantage Miles per team member (max 5) to the 3rd place winning team at the Grand Finale on December 17, 2014.
$100 per team member (max 5) + Developer Zone Prize Pack
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of MasterCard's Simplify Commerce or MasterPass APIs

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $1000 for team that Esri selects as Best Use of Esri Technology
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Esri Technology Prize

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Advising Lunch with Robert Scoble will include tailored advice and industry insight from one of the top thought leaders in Tech and some social media shootouts.
Justinmind is offering free perpetual licenses for the Top 3 teams (max 5 persons/team)

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: 1) Did the team have a working demo? 2) If not, will it be completed in 30 days? 3) Does the App solve a real world or business problem? 4) No. of provided APIs used. 5) Is the UX/UI elegant, seamless, and easy to use? 6) Would you use it at the airport?

hackathon-description-header: An Innovative Virtual Developer Challenge Featuring San Francisco International Airport (SFO)
